fields.name: Meadowfoam honey
fields.description: You have never tasted a honey like this. One of our most popular & flavorful honeys, our Meadowfoam Honey has a noticeable taste of vanilla and roasted marshmallow.

fields.name: Acacia Honey
fields.description: Perhaps the clearest & lightest honey you will ever see, our Acacia Honey has traveled all the way from Transylvania, Romania to get us. Acacia Honey is not only light in color, it is also delicate in taste.  It’s perfect for adding sweetness without overpowering.

fields.name: Blackberry Honey
fields.description: The wet climate of the Pacific Northwest provides ideal growing conditions for wild blackberries, and thus blackberry honey.  Come late spring, dormant plants explode with delicate white blossoms that provide ample pollen for hungry honeybees.  The honey they produce adds a pleasant but not overpowering sweetness to tea and baked goods.

fields.name: Buckwheat Honey
fields.description: Buckwheat honey is best known as a baker’s honey because its molasses-like flavor and consistency works well in many desserts. And pancakes. Buckwheat is a cover crop cultivated throughout the United States, which means bees pollinate buckwheat all over. We source ours from the Pacific Northwest to guarantee the right timing and buckwheat density to control for maximum honey purity.

fields.name: Gallberry Honey
fields.description: Within the pine-wooded wetlands of the southeast US grows the Gallberry Bush. From April to June, the evergreen bush practically drips nectar, providing a feast for local bees.  Light in color, with a molasses inspired sweetness, Gallberry Honey is a versatile “everyday” treat that is great for baking.

fields.name: Orange Blossom Honey
fields.description: Sweet orange tree buds begin to form in January and February, setting the scene for a grove-y experience for local pollinators when blossoms come in April. Orange blossom honey comes from, you guessed it, orange grove blossoms. Beekeepers release bees to pollinate the orange grove blossoms across orange-growing regions like Florida, California, and less commonly south Texas.

fields.name: Pure Cranberry Honey
fields.description: Cranberries in the Pine Barrens of New Jersey are in full bloom in August as the berries kick off their growth and get ready for harvest in September. When the berries are at the fullest, farmers flood the cranberry bogs and use a paddle boat to knock the berries off the submerged bushes, allowing them to float to the surface for easy harvesting.

fields.name: Pure Sage Honey
fields.description: Our Sage Honey comes from the nectar of the clary sage plant (salvia sclarea). This pure, unfiltered honey hails from the Umpqua basin in Western Oregon, not too far from the city of Yoncalla. Sage Honey is similar in both color and taste to tupelo honey, and its high ratio of fructose to glucose sugars make it very slow to crystallize.

fields.name: Raspberry Honey
fields.description: Our Raspberry Honey hails from the raspberry fields found in Central New Jersey.  A wonderful clean sweetness with a hint of the tartness that comes straight from the raspberry nectar.

fields.name: Sourwood Honey
fields.description: We bottle Sourwood Honey in our elegant Spanish bottles to show off just how beautiful honey can be.  It’s the perfect gift to take to a dinner party in place of a bottle of wine.

fields.name: Sourwood Honey Queenline
fields.description: Every August, in the North Carolina Mountains, when those buzzing honeybees fly off to feed on the sweet nectar of those beautiful fleecy white flowers that hang low on the Sourwood Trees, beekeepers are ready and waiting to capture one of the most sought after monofloral honeys in the whole world, Sourwood Honey. It has a beautiful straw color, and a soft, buttery, caramel aftertaste.

fields.name: Tupelo Honey
fields.description: Tupelo Honey is not only famous for its rarity, if anything the real fame comes from the taste. Tupelo has been considered the “gold standard of honey.” The taste is buttery, the texture is smooth, and flavor hits on the back on the tongue producing one of the most unique honeys in the world.

fields.name: Wildflower Honey Muth Jar
fields.description: Bursting with flavor and sweetness, our Wildflower Honey is a classic. Coming from a variety of diverse nectar sources, our Wildflower is as complex as it is sweet.

fields.name: Fireweed Honey
fields.description: Regarded as the “Champagne of Honey” Fireweed Honey’s clear and smooth consistency aligns perfectly with its light, yet distinguished flavor. Fireweed honey is the result of bees harvesting the nectar from the beautiful pink flowers of fireweed plants that grow across the Pacific Northwest, Alaska, and Canada.

fields.name: Pure Tulip Poplar Honey
fields.description: Come Spring, tulip poplar trees (which can grow upwards of 150 ft!) explode with teacup-shaped blossoms.  Honey bees in select regions from New York to Southern Georgia transform this Spring bounty into a honey that is dark in color and strong in taste.

fields.name: Saw Palmetto Honey
fields.description: Come late Spring, South Carolina and Florida’s saw palmetto trees sprout tiny white buds, creating a bounty of pollen for local honey bees.  The result?  A distinctly southern honey that pairs perfectly with the quintessential southern beverage: sweet tea!

fields.name: Wildflower Honey
fields.description: Our Wildflower Honey is clean, crisp and sweet to the taste.  Perfect to accompany a hot tea or drizzle over a fresh baked biscuit.

fields.name: Honeycomb Square
fields.description: Wildflower Honeycomb is 12 ounces of pure deliciousness. You can’t get any rawer than honeycomb straight from the beehive.

fields.name: Bee Pollen
fields.description: Bee Pollen is collected right from the bees knees.  It is a great source of protein and is considered a “super food.”  We have had many customers attest to the fact that local pollen has assisted in helping work as an immune builder towards local allergies.  Bee Pollen also gives one an energy boost.

fields.name: Honey Tonic – Elderberry
fields.description: Elderberry honey tonic is made with black elderberry, echinacea tops, and propolis to help immune support. Full Ingredients — Raw Honey, raw apple cider vinegar*, black elderberry fruit*, echinacea tops*, bee propolis

fields.name: Honey Tonic – Ginger
fields.description: Ginger Honey Tonic – crafted for happy tummies! Full Ingredients — Raw Honey, raw apple cider vinegar*, ginger root (Zingiber officinalis). Try in tea or sparkling water!

fields.name: Honey Tonic – Relaxation
fields.description: Relaxation Honey Tonic is crafted with a blend of gentle, relaxing herbs for noursing the nervous system.

fields.name: Honey Tonic – Throat & Lung
fields.description: hroat & Lung Honey Tonic is a blend of herbs and propolis that help support the respiratory system.

fields.name: Bee Pollen Chocolate Bars
fields.description: Bean to Bar, with a little love from a hive! 66% Dark Chocolate topped with Apricots, Honey , Marigold Petals and Bee Pollen

fields.name: Acacia Honey with Comb
fields.description: Perhaps the clearest & lightest honey you will ever see, our Acacia Honey has traveled all the way from Transylvania, Romania to get us. Acacia Honey is not only light in color, it is also delicate in taste.  It’s perfect for adding sweetness without overpowering.

fields.name: Honeycomb Jar
fields.description: We dropped a hearty chunk of raw honeycomb right into our wildflower honey. It doesn’t get any rawer, taster, or more nostalgic than pure honeycomb right out of the beehive. 100% edible & 100% delicious.

fields.name: Chai-Infused Honey
fields.description: Our chai-infused honey is made from an assortment of complementary spices including star anise, cardamon, cinnamon, ginger, and…well, the rest is a secret! This bold infusion packs a warm spicy chai honey flavor. Honey infused with chai is as delicious and unique as it sounds, and it happens to be one of the most popular honeys at our tasting bar!

fields.name: Cocoa-Infused Honey
fields.description: This infusion was specifically crafted for the chocolate lover. We infuse raw honey with pure raw cacao to bring you the most decadent and delicious honey infusion yet. Plus raw cocoa nibs and raw honey is a much healthier option for a chocolate drizzle on just about anything! Enjoy your post-dinner chocolate with no guilt attached.

fields.name: Ghost Pepper Spicy Honey
fields.description: Sweet heat, spicy honey. Spice up your life with our sensational, seasonal Ghost Pepper Spicy Honey! We take our delicious Raw Honey and infuse it with a beautiful, Asheville grown red Ghost Pepper. Perfect for cooking and spicing up any and all dishes.

fields.name: Mint Infused Honey
fields.description: Made with fresh Mint harvested here in the Appalachian mountains, this sweet treat is a great way to freshen up tea, drizzled over ice cream, or paired with a sharp goat cheese.

fields.name: Rosemary Infused Honey
fields.description: Our Rosemary Infused honey is the right balance of sweet and bitter. The perfect addition to a charcuterie board, added to tomato sauces, or drizzled over your protein of choice!

fields.name: Vanilla-Infused Honey
fields.description: Vanilla is one of the most popular flavorings in the whole world, so it’s no wonder why vanilla and honey make a great combination. Did you know vanilla is the only edible fruit within the Orchid family? Our vanilla-infused honey is made from fresh ground Madagascar vanilla beans set into pure, raw honey. The resulting vanilla honey flavor is deep, rich, and oh so sweet.
